transcript.text: Shalom Shalom Shalom it is now the night
Tuesday night December 12 2017 is is the
first night officially of Chanukah 2017
Chanukah of the Jubilee year also known
as the feast of dedication or the winter
feast the festival of lights is also as
it is known this is the feast of
Hanukkah it lasts for eight days and we
know that even Yahshua of Nazareth Jesus
himself celebrated Hanukkah you can read
about it in John chapter 10 starting in
verse 22 where he celebrated Hanukkah up
at the temple in Solomon's porch and
contended with the pharisees and
sadducees up at the Temple Mount this is
a very important feast to observe and to
keep it has prophetic implications but I
just want to briefly talk about what
Hanukah is all about if you read first
and second Maccabees which are detailed
historical accounts of what occurred
you'll find out all the events that that
happened for Hanukah
but basically what happened was a small
band of guerrilla warfare fighters known
as the Maccabees
they pledged their hearts in their lives
to yah they said that they would obey
the Torah and they asked yah to help
them defeat the Greeks the Greeks had
come in and basically overrun Israel
they had destroyed the temple sacrificed
to pick on the altar force the Jews to
eat unclean foods and not keep Sabbath
and enslaved them and so the Maccabees
from the surrounding Judean hillside
began to launch a guerrilla warfare
tactics against the largest empire in
the world at the time and after a period
of three and a half years they
completely and totally drove the Greek
armies out of Israel and liberated
Israel and at the end of that three and
a half years right around this time they
rebuilt the temple they cleansed it and
then rededicated it and it took eight
days for them to rededicate and to
cleanse the temple so that it could come
back into full operation and so that is
why we celebrate Hanukkah for eight days
of course we have eight candlesticks
share along with the ninth Center
candlestick which symbolizes yah yah
said he is the light of the world and so
that's why this is the festival of
lights
but this festival is about overcoming
impossible odds to the power of Yama
that if we put our full faith in Him
we yield our wills completely to him if
we obey Him and pledge to obey his Torah
to the best of our ability if we promise
and we actually love him with all our
heart soul mind and strength and love
our neighbors herself he will help us
overcome impossible odds in our lives
just as he helped that small band of
Jewish rebels the Maccabees overcome the
largest empire the Greeks way back then
and it's also about rededicating your
temple to Yahshua because this is the
time they rededicated the temple they
cleansed the temple they brought it back
to full functionality this is when we
rededicate our temples our hearts our
lives our bodies to yata it's eight days
it's a festive feast a lot of people say
oh you can't do a nine branch tonic here
because that that deviates from the
scriptural seven branch menorah but
that's not true you go to Zechariah you
will see a seven branch menorah and on
either side there are two olive trees
representing the two witnesses which
forms a nine tiered menorah or a
Hanukkah which foreshadowed this very
festival the feast of Hanukkah which is
from the 25th day of the ninth month and
always goes for eight days it is the
only feast day that straddles two
different months we start off in the 90
per month and by the time we get to the
last day of Hanukkah we'll be second or
third day into the Tempe per month so
we'll actually have a new moon in the
midst of Hanukkah this year as we do
every year and yeah it's just a time of
rejoicing of praising Yama
of glorifying him and of recognizing
that when we pledge our hearts to him he
will help us overcome impossible odds in
our lives and a time to rededicate our
lives in our hearts to him so I want to
wish everyone a very Happy Hanukkah 2017
I'm gonna try to post videos every night
for all eight nights of Hanukkah this
year as my wife and I celebrate this
Jubilee Hanukkah festival season and I
just pray that you all have a very very
blessed Hanukkah I think this is a very
very important feast and certainly a
good time to rededicate yourself to in
joy and in love hallelujah this is
Daniel John Lee with tor restoration
ministries the website is spirit and tor
calm happy Chanukah everyone Shalom
